Summary: We stayed in one of the 3rd floor rooms (#331). It was clean, no bugs. No fan in the bathroom. Nice size TV on the wall. We were asked to not smoke in the room. We followed the rules, and I did get my $100 deposit back. I know this is probably most peoples' concern.

Summary Heading: A terrible hotel! Don’t stay there
Summary: This is a terrible establishment. It is going through a renovation but I was placed in one room that was downright scary. I complained and was placed in a room where the heat didn’t work. It was 1:00 am and I just toughed it out. It is truly a cheap place in price and quality.  Asked for a refund on that night and to cancel a second night.  Wound up wasting $207 dollars. Plenty of other hotels available. Don’t let my mistake be yours. Don’t stay here.

We looked at this location in an effort to save a couple bucks. We arrived here well after 11pm to check-in. The lobby was being renovated and we weren't able to enter. The lack of lighting on the walkways at night is concerning. Old furniture and construction debris is abundant throughout the location. Be very careful walking on the 2nd floor tile walkway in the rain. Our room was 331 and upon arrival it looked like a remodel was attempted. Rusty light fixtures, as well as rust in the bathtub. The bug on the pillow was a big red flag, but my wife was trying to remain upbeat about our trip. The next day when we returned from Disneyland there were a couple more bugs in our room. Later that evening we were awakened by someone beating on our door. It was a lady asking if I knew the

Friendly greeting but rundown place. Peeling wallpaper. Fridge leaked & had food left in it.  She copied my credit card which I called and cancelled afterwards after reading reports of fraud from here.  The office is under renovation so no breakfast. Hopefully they're upgrading the whole place. It needs it.  I think the young lady who helped me is the owner and she tries to run and clean the place on her own w a toddler on hand. Think she's trying her best but I wouldn't stay here again with all the other options in the area
Room tip: Very small and tight parking lot/spaces. No breakfast. Loud street noise

Summary: We stayed here last week and figured we just needed a clean place to sleep and store our bags while we did Disney all day so we weren’t looking for much.   We were disappointed to find it wasn’t clean and we were hesitant about leaving our bags there as a result.   There were foreign long hairs wadded up on the floor of the bathroom and on the walls of the shower. I made the mistake of looking under the bed when we were leaving to check for personal items….there was a lot of dirt, dust bunnies and food wrappers that didn’t belong to us. My sister in law stayed a few doors down and killed 3-4 cockroaches in the 3 nights we stayed there. We checked for bed bugs and didn’t see any thankfully.   On the plus side, the AC worked. There was a bus stop close by that takes you to Disney

It was terrible !! I booked this room 7 months ago ; we get here in time to eat and go to bed in anticipation of Disneyland the next day . We get in the room and only one of the outlets in the whole room works..not to mention broken lights between the beds . Anyways...2 hours later with manager coming in and out flipping lights on and off with the breaker...we end up with extension cords linked together all over the room !!! Grrrr.!!!

Summary Heading: Walked right in, and walked right back out
Summary: This is the most disgusting place I have ever walked into. I booked with Hotwire and called them that they better refund me or find me another hotel because that place was filthy! Stains, dirty! Disgusting

Unless you want drugs offered to you at your door & fraud happening to your card then this place is for you! Took an hour just to checkout because of the fraud happening and me calling them out. Never will i even look at this place! The pictures? Not what you get at all. Do not stay at this place. Spend a little more and go elsewhere

motel was ok, not that close to Disney, but stil 15-20 mins walking distance. Shopping center was at driving distance, around 10 mins. Breakfast was basic, coffee, muffins. Chosen this one as our family of 4 was budget travelers. Parking free and reserved for customers, just in case notify them in advance.

As I have seen someone else say this, it is true.  We should have checked Yelp before booking this hotel.  I'll start with the Pros--close to Disneyland park.  We walked every day from hotel. Cons--many-the pics will speak for themselves.   Rust everywhere, peeling paint on ceiling,  outlets would not hold the plug in unless you propped up something against it, no wash cloths one of the days (had to use a small towel to wash my face).  They did have a microwave and mini frig if you need something like that.  The breakfast is VERY minimal,  small muffins, juice and coffee.  There is no hairdryer so bring your own.

Our stay was specifically for Disneyland and it was very good in regards to location. When we checked in it took the front desk person about 15 minutes to show up, after we rang the bell a few times.  The room was pretty rough but clean enough.   We did feel pretty safe as most people were families staying for Disneyland. The rooms were non smoking and there was free parking.   The complimentary breakfast was poor, only some muffins, but for the price we paid it was alright.  The pillows were very hard and the soap was really bad quality   Cheap and good location is all I can say!

Summary Heading: A little sceptical because of the reviews, but pleasantly surprised.
Summary: Look, you get what you pay for and this is an extremely cheap choice for a hotel. I stayed here when I went to Blizzcon and I have to say, I am extremely happy with our choice. It was clean, the staff were friendly and the location is brilliant.   If you are travelling on a budget, do not expect a five star hotel, because you won't get one. This was a great place to put my head down after a long day, and I absolutely recommend this place to anyone who would prefer to spend their cash on anything other than a view.  Really enjoyed my stay here.

Summary Heading: Not far to Disneyland but there are better options
Summary: Location - approx 15min walk to Disneyland and $12 USD Uber/Lyft to the Honda Centre.  We stayed two nights and picked here for the location and price.  The rooms are older but ok however on the first night, after being at Disneyland all day, we came back to see that the vanity sink had leaked and there was water coming out of the pipe underneath and water was all over the floor.  The person on duty had to call in a maintenance person and we were not offered another room (upon asking we were informed they were booked out).   Our booking stated that breakfast was included however we were not provided any details and were given the impression that there wasn't any. On checkout when we asked about this we were informed that breakfast was actually just a mini muffin and a juice

If i were able to, I’d give 0 points.  It was dirty, hairs everywhere, bad breakfast choice.   The walk to Disneyland is about 15 minutes. Supposedly it was shorter before they added Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge and guests were able to use a cast member entrance (? Not sure if that’s true)

We stayed for three nights while visiting Disneyland and were happy with the stay. As it is a budget hotel we were expecting clean, basic rooms and they delivered.  We had two beds which were well made, a tv with lots of channel choices and a working bathroom.  The shower pressure was a bit low for our liking but other than that it was fine. The sinks were outside the bathroom which we were not expecting but worked well.  The breakfast wasn’t really impressive, the only things available were coffee, tea and juice with mini muffins. Not really a sustainable breakfast and the muffin quality wasn’t good.  The staff service was okay, check in and out was fast and they provide maps of the area for Disney and eateries.  You get what you pay for with this hotel, if you’re expecting a

I thought I would save us money by getting a cheap room near Disneyland since we had already spent so much on our resort over an hour away. This place is worse than a motel6. I was so upset that I put my family through this. The lights were falling off. There were wires and a broken phone jack hanging under the desk. There was no tissue or tissue cover in the sink area. The bathroom was disgusting. The sheets didnt stay on the nasty mattresses. Everything was old and run down.

We spontaneously decided to stay here because we were coming from San Diego and we didnt want to get stuck in traffic in the morning commute. Front desk personnel was very pleasant so I hate to write a bad review, but I cant hold back talking about how awful the rooms are at this hotel. Parking, first off, is super tight. When we finally got to the room we just wanted to relax and get some rest. This room actually made me feel dirty. The carpets are disgusting, the wallpaper on the walls is peeling, and the beds were dirty. We tried to watch some TV to get our minds off how gross this place was, and the remote for the tv didnt even work. The beds were super uncomfortable and there was literally a hole in the wall in the bathroom. The AC cover was missing so there was a giant

This motel has roaches everywhere in the room and one climbed on my foot. It smells like mold, the bedding was very dirty, the floor was so gross and dirty like it's never cleaned with visible dirt and urine around the toilet. Hair on the wall in the shower. The wallpaper is warped from water damage. Do not stay here! We left and asked for a refund.

We stayed at the hotel because my family and I had to unexpectedly stay another night in Anaheim and this was a great price- The hotel is obviously being updated so there was a few features that were a slight eye sore, but they are working on it. The hotel room itself was very clean, well kept and perfect for what we needed. The staff was very helpful and kind. I was a little nervous about staying here after the reviews but I'm glad we that did. I love supporting this sweet little hotel.

We slept in this hotel because it is close to Disneyland. I did not read the comments before and I’m glad I didn’t otherwise I would probably didn’t book it. We had a big and clean room. For us it was the perfect spot to stay 4 nights because it’s close to Disney. Only 20 min walk to the parking trams.

I would NOT recommend to anyone! We stayed 2 night both nights couldn't sleep because of the loud noise, people were moving furniture above us!  Room was dirty, smelly and very old. Bathroom was disgusting we didn't have a shower as towels were old and stained, no soap, no shampoo no hairdryer! Absolutely shocking!!! Not too sure how it's still open!!!

Summary Heading: HOW IT'S STILL OPEN, I WILL NEVER KNOW!!
Summary: Disgusting!!! Stinky!!! Sleazy!!! After 12 hours at Disneyland I just wanted to go back to our room and take a hot bath, well that didn't happen..... I walked into the stinky bathroom to find the handles had been cut off the giant jacuzzi tub, and the towels were dirty. A paint bucket with paint tools was left under the bathroom sink. Trash in our closet. Wall paper peeling off the walls... So my husband called the front desk so we could get a new room. The new room we were moved to looked like a 5 year old did the electrical work, work was not legal by any stretch of the imagination!! Do not stay here, you will regret it!!

My experience staying here was horrible.  Our room was smelly and the bathroom smell had a permanent smell of kaka.  The carpet was disgusting and we always had black at the bottom of our feet.  The manager/owner needs to fix this place.  Yes you get what you paid for, but I would not recommend this place to anyone.    This place is horrible.

Great close to home and and great service and quite cozy and nice little get away from home very pleasant staff allowed early and late check out at last moment which was great not bothered by staff at all for anything had a couple additional guest over no problems

it’s the worst place. Horrible service!!! I have been asking for help since 6:20 am without any luck, just to be answered by a person that hangs up on me asking me to stop calling. I was given that number in case I needed something. It’s completely illogical having to wait until 7 am for someone to actually open the front desk. BUT apparently that’s what you should expect from this people. NO SERVICE at all from 11 pm until 7 am.  If this people don’t want to be bothered while they sleep... THEY SHOULD LEAVE A FREAKING HAIR DRYER IN THE ROOM!!!!

This is the worst hotel ever. Rooms were dirty. Electrics unsafe, stains on walls, water damage to ceiling and chunks falling off. Floors were laminate and uneven. Free breakfast is a joke, muffin, orange juice that is disgusting or so.e other colored watery stuff. Outside the room smelt of urine. Spend a little more and get a better hotel

We checked into this dreadful olace after a 9 hr drive. To say that the place is tired is an understatement. As we entered the outside stair well there was a stench of urine, once in the room we found lots of unsavoury stuff: unstable ceiling that had obvious untreated water damage, rusty plud holes on tje sink and bath. The ele trical outlets were seriously over rowded and unsafe. Very noisy air con that was really old. Lots of flaky paint, laminate floors that did not fit, i could go on and on. The staff in the front desk were ok if you could find them. The " continental" breakfast was a joke....a muffin. We will not be staying again. My advice is avoid this place.....you have been warned.

I have never given 1 star before.  ....until now.  This hotel exemplifies everything that can be wrong with public lodging.  Thinking we would ‘save a little money’ we stayed here, unfortunately before reading any reviews.  Where do I start...... The hotel is old.   Very old.  I should have realized the class of hotel by the prostitute  hanging out near the lobby During check in.  The room smelled dank.   Signs of wear and decay where everywhere.  From the liquid staining on the wall mounted lamp shades (how do you get liquid stains on wall mounted lamp shades????  ) to the chipped and scratched paint everywhere. We returned to the reception where we explained our issue and were shown another room. Initially the key wouldn't work so we returned for a third time to reception. The second room was just as bad. So I’ve been to a few rough and ready places before, but once the bed linen is clean and I felt safe then that was what mattered. I got neither at the Anaheim Maingate Inn.  Myself and my friend were spending the day at Disneyland on Thursday 3rd May so were due to book into the Anaheim Maingate in on Thursday. We arrived at 7pm and have to say our first impressions were that it was nice and close to Disney and it looked...ok. We had a really smooth check in with a lovely staff member who was courteous and friendly. We were given room 109 and immediately went to the room. As we graced the threshold of the door, a chill went down my spine. On the positive side the bus stop is just outside the hotel to go to Disneyland (or coming back) but you can also take a walk. Aprox 20 minutes

Summary: Anaheim Maingate Inn was hands-down, the most unhygienic hotel room I have ever come across. It's unacceptable that a business like this charges people to stay in such dirty rooms. HAIR everywhere. We moved rooms because we found hair everywhere & the tub wouldnt drain in the first room. In the 2nd room, hair everywhere again. Hair on the bathroom floor, clump of hair in the sink, floss on the bathroom floor, at least 6 pieces of hair on the sheets, eyelash found on the sheets, big white stain on the sheets, stains on the walls. I even looked closer & saw a scab on the floor. This room was something out of my nightmares. Also the reservation didn't mention that the front desk lobby closes at midnight. Be weary of this when the Disneyland park closes at midnight some nights. My

My fiancé and I go to Disneyland at least once a year. When you go to Disneyland I feel like you spend alllll day there and when you get done you just want a place that is close and comfortable so that you can just crash out! It doesn’t need to be some big lavish hotel cause you are literally just there to get a good nights rest before waking up and doing it all over again. This hotel is soooo close(easy walking distance) to the bus/shuttle area that just takes you right up to the main gate of Disneyland. You can’t beat the price. You can’t beat the location. You can’t beat the great guest service/hospitality. We refer ALL our friends and family and coworkers here and of the like 30 people we know that have taken our advice, they all agree! This place is just down right awesome!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: It’s cheap and close to Disneyland. Although the walk is a bit further since they closed off a short cut.  The beds were comfortable and the shower hot. The room was spacious enough although basic. If you’re like me and just use the room to crash in at night then it’s fine. More money for shopping. It can be a little noisy the walls can seem a it thin. I didn’t have any problems with finding somewhere to park the car either.  The included breakfast is not worth calling it anymore than a coffee and muffin, but it’s there. I read some horror reviews and certainly didn’t have the same experience.  I found the staff particularly friendly and helpful.

For about $70 a night you are not getting the Ritz Carlton. The only redeeming feature of this hotel was the location. It's about a 15 to 20 minute walk to the park. The hotel is badly in need of a deep cleaning. The floor was so disgusting we had to wear socks the whole time. The cleaning woman was short. How do we know? There was a foot of dirt on the top of the mirror where you could tell she could not reach. I also appreciated the spider webs in the corner. Made it feel like Halloween!! But, for a quick weekend trip, it was serviceable.

We stayed here for Tinkerbell Half Marathon weekend back in May 2017.  The website states 5 min walking to Disneyland Tram. We found out once we got there that the 5 min walk is now more like 25.  Asked at the front desk about it and was told it was Disney fault.  I ask why they don't take the statement down from website and on answering machine, no answer.  We had already booked for Labor day weekend here thorugh booking.com paid up front.  Called Motel and asked if we could get out of reservation due to the long walk and they authoized it.  Booking.com also called and they authoized the cancelation.  They since have refused to refund anything after saying twice they would.  Booking.com ended up having to pay us back as they were the booking agent.  This place is not honest and

First day the manager was on the counter I requested for a additional key card she refuse to give me one more and made comments first I didn't ask for your comments. How much and how troublesome to issue one more card key. I been all over the world this is the first time I had experience it. Take note I'm a paying customers. Service and courtesy should be render at all time.  Second day jonna duty at the desk no problem simple request was given and service was excellent we should more personnel like her. Respectful and courteous and service with a smile.  To the owner or higher above please take note of the difference in service. Well you guys won't care anyway money is important rather than the comments from your customers   Your unhappy customer  George

Rooms really need updating but was clean . Staff very friendly and very close to Disney .. Ideal if you are on a budget . Free parking and the breakfast muffins were nice !! For the money you pay it does the job .. Clean towels everyday. Sheets changed twice over the 5 days we stayed there . But if your looking for a bit of luxury don't go here but a place to stay no frills near Disney it's ideal !!

WARNING!! DO NOT STAY AT Maingate Inn!! They are crooks! We have cancelled our reservation with Booking.com and were promised a full refund with the hotel and two days in a row they have made charges on our card (IN ADDITION TO OUR ORIGINAL HOTEL STAY PAYMENT). We have not been refunded our cancellation. They state on their website, and answer machine they are five minutes from the tram and this is no longer true. (This is the reason why we cancelled the reservations). I get put on hold for over 40 minutes at a time to reach the owner of the hotel just to be told he is not in, EACH TIME! I repeat, DO NOT STAY AT MAINGATE INN!!  They also told us to park out on the street since there was no available parking. WHO DOES THAT! So we told them to move their vehicle so THEY COULD

Gross, smelly, neglected. I don't really even want to return to Anaheim. Such a bad experience. Little things like you have to pay for ice (it's frozen water), no water in vending machine, gang signs tagged on inside of bathroom door, giant spider in our room, someone's dirty panties on the floor in bathroom, bathroom door touches toilet paper roll, some random hole under sink with cool air blowing in.  Couldn't wait to leave

We spent two days in Disneyland, while we were staying in Van Nuys, California, about 90 miles (about 160km). We did not want to get into traffic just for a few hours, so we decided to find an hotel near the park, without spending too much money. We already had stayed in other hotels, but we found them quite expensive just for a night of sleep. We found this one, and it looked very near the park. It really is, but be careful you have to do a little walk into the Disney Tram aerea. It is very confortable, parking area was right below our room, easy access. Big and comfortable bed, functional bathroom and correct air conditioning. Maybe it is not suitable for long stays, but for a couple of days in Disneyland is perfect just for night sleep. Remember, there is a 10-15 minute walk

Worst hotel ever, small parking, room smelled like mold, beds not comfortable at all, no swimming pool, customer service good but bad exprience, got a dent in my car because of how the parking lot is to small.

No refund. after getting off a 11hr Flight. taking a taxi Which took over a hr to get there and $100. to find out are room was not on there system. we took a new room for three nights Instead of. the 7 nights we booked. moving room as the first room was not clean. getting a new hotel only staying there under a hr. to find out the Manager was out sick and they did not know when he would be back to do a refund. but later to find out the manager would and will not give us are money back after staying there again under a hr. never go here there was Insects in the sink.

The only thing nice at this hotel is the sign out in front! The cleaning ladies are extremely pleasant and try their best. But the building and the rooms are disgusting. They are falling apart. Only one outlet worked in the entire room. The lampshades over the bed where just sitting on top of the light bulbs, fire hazardous! Homeless People live in the rooms months at a time. Positive the young Man that was arrested the first night we were here was dealing drugs out of the room. Oh and there are only 5 regular parking spaces! And those "living" in their rooms claim  those 5 spaces and place orange cones to reserve them when they go out. Ice is sold!! And what breakfast !? Gosh I couldn't wait for our 4 days to be over! Never again!

I was expecting a clean, pleasant room when I entered the anaheim maingate inn, but instead I was met with a filthy slophole. The floors left our socks black, the bathroom was filthy (toilet and shower had not been thoroughly cleaned), and the walls were dirty and had writing on them. Luckily, we were able to be transferred to an inhabitable room, although the toilet did not work well, nor did all of the lights. Overall, I would suggest never booking this hotel, as they seem to lack any care for cleanliness.

We stayed here for two nights. After having spent the first night and all day at Disneyland, we came  back to find a bed bug on the pillow. They moved us to another room which was ok but still not great. You are better off staying at a nicer hotel next door for a few more dollars.

If you are here for a review of this place turn around now and find another!! This is the most disgusting motel on this planet. They must pay someone off to allow this place to stay in operation. Disgustingly dirty with filth from floor to ceiling. Mold growing on baseboards, walls and cabinets in bathroom and beyond filthy beds, sheets, towels and furniture. Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at
Summary: I will start by saying that I have stayed at all kinds of hotels from high end to very low end but this hotel can't even compare with low end. Not sure how it hasn't been condemned. Let's start with the room we got was a handicap room which was never requested and I believe may have been there old laundry or housekeeping break/ work room. It was right in between the office and there now laundry/housekeeping room which meant every morning at 6 we had housekeeping out side our door getting all there supplies ready on the carts which was not quite at all on top of the big dryer vent that was right outside our door. Not quite sure what the housekeepers were getting together because clearly our room was filthy dirty and not up kept at all. The baseboards were disgusting and caked

Summary Heading: Decent one night stay, good price
Summary: The staff was very friendly and accommodating, the room, while tastefully decorated, had a not so clean bathroom, there was mold in the tile and the tub was spotted...the breakfast was very simple, a cup of orange juice or coffee, and a breakfast muffin...on a more positive note, it had a very easy walk to the tram to the Disneyland main gate

Summary Heading: Location is great; the rest, eh
Summary: The location is amazing. A five minute walk and you are on the tram to the Disney parks. We were so happy to have free parking at the hotel so we could just leave our car there and walk over to the parks. That's a definite perk.   Staff is very friendly, as well. And you can't beat the price. Overall we were pleased with our stay, especially since we basically just needed a place to sleep after a busy day at the parks.   BUT, there are definite drawbacks. The rooms, while clean, are old and fairly rundown. Things that I'm used to in bugger hotels (a hair dyer, for instance) aren't available. The breakfast was a joke; we purposely booked a place with a free breakfast so this was disappointing. Just a couple muffins and juice. The beds were extremely uncomfortable, as well.   So,

I would not stay here again. Pay the extra money to stay at a different hotel. Don't let their name fool you, it is an old, dingy motel. There is no 5 minute walk to Disneyland, there is however, a 5 minute walk through the employee parking structure and down to the tram that goes to Disneyland (only benefit of staying at this motel). This had stair access only, FYI.  ROOM: There were holes in the sheets and stains on the towels. The room smelled musty and was generally not clean - lots of marks and smudges on walls. Very non-traditional room with high ceilings and overhangs that probably contained all manner of dust and crap - we didn't dare look. Couch looked in terrible shape and they had attempted to screw the cushions into the back... so they wouldn't get stolen? Normal bed

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service, Great Location, Below Average Rooms
Summary: We just stayed her due to the location. 5 minute walk to the main parking tram. The staff was great, early check in, no  they stored our bags. Great WiFi. The pictures on the site are not what I stayed in. My room was very run down and in need of an update like the picture. We did have a fridge and microwave, but no alarm clocks and no hair dryer for my wife. The bed was hard and if they are renovating you couldn't tell. We stayed all three nights just do to the great price but will not return, will try any of the other motels next to it.

Great location. Access Disney via employee parking lot. Breakfast are two kinds of mini muffin, coffee and some kind of orange drink. There is a thick layer of dust and dirt on the walls. There is some kind of smell by the bathroom. The phone is not working and the front desk just told me to jiggle the wire. Still did not work. Parking in the property is terrible. Unless you're desperate, the property needs major update and a really good cleaning.

Summary Heading: Location perfect, Hotel average, Personal items went missing.
Summary: Location is perfect, with a short walk to the Disneyland trams. Room was average, but for the price provided a comfortable night sleep during our stay for 4 nights to visit Disneyland. The room was noisy, being located right next to Ball Road and one of the backstage entrances to Disneyland the morning traffic almost shook the room. Some of our personal items (a bag full of souvenirs) went missing during the stay which makes me livid, half of the souvenirs were from various countries and can't be replaced, it makes no sense that housekeeping should touch anything that was sitting inside a suitcase, and besides they should be careful not to throw away personal property.

Positives: It's really close to the trams to get to the gates of Disney.  Decent bed  Maid service every day  You could see the fireworks from Disneyland in certain rooms.  Negatives: Dirty, I found a baked bean on the floor the day of checking in as well as a mosquito in my ice bucket, and the sofa was filthy, as were many there things and I didn't want to walk on the carpet.   One of the lights in the bathroom was out   The towels were tiny and often in a bad condition.  I felt unsafe as one night a strange man was stood on some of the building stairs staring and saying things. Also the hotel outbuilding also acts as a complete road to road drive through so anyone can drive in and park.  There are no safes in the room so be sure to not leave anything valuable in your room.

The room is not luxurious, but the bed is good and it's clean. The people at reception are kind and very helpfull. Within walking distance of the Disney parking shuttle. Perfect for a Disney holiday. There's a supermarket at short distance and the public Anaheim bus stop is around the corner.

Location 5/5  But if you have loud neighbours, good luck. I could hear every word of there conversation clear as anything, was like an episode of Big Brother. Woken up at 12am-4am and then again at 6am... both nights. I was wondering round Disneyland half asleep.  Wasn't happy. Shame because it's a great location.

We were a couple visiting Disneyland. This inn was excellent value for money, just walking distance to the park.  The room furnishings were old, but that didn't matter to us who spent all day in the Disney parks Bed was comfy and air conditioning worked. Which was all we needed really.. no complaints from us at all

I walked in to the room that had a foul, musty smell. Turned on the air and it helped with the smell. There were loose hardwood floor boards that as i was walking i did shide on as it moved, i just covered it with the dirty nasty rug that was in the room. The bathroom was absolutely disgusting!  Black mold everywhere and the lights in the bathroom had wires and were all exposed. The dead bolt did not work. Then as i reuturned to my room around 830 am my key didnt work. Summary Heading: Not as bad as they say
Summary: Just returned from a stay in Anaheim here.  This place is not as bad as others make it out to be.  The rooms are average size, nothing was falling off/apart, everything was clean.  Our room had hardwood floors so we didn't experience the so-called "black sock" residue they say happens.  The distance to the Disneyland tram is great; just a short jaunt through the cast member parking lot, down a corridor, and you're there.  The front desk staff even explain how to get there.  The staff was very friendly.  The ambient noise outside was loud, but that's to be expected in resort area hotels.  Don't be so quick to dismiss this place; everyone is a critic of one small hair is out of place.  We were completely satisfied and would not hesitate to stay here again in the future!

The only reason we stayed here was that they had 4 nights in a row.  Now I know why. Take my advice and move from hotel to hotel instead of staying here. The room smelled bad.  The floors were so dirty and sticky that we had to wear socks around the room to protect our feet. The socks got thrown out, I don't think they will come clean.  The phone was not even plugged in.  We never once got enough towels, had to ask every day.  The maids do not speak any English so they were no help.  They turned the AC off in the room every day , so we came back every day to a hot, humid room.  PLUS you had to pay for ice. Take my advice DO NOT STAY HERE.

Summary Heading: What you get is what you paid for... but is walking distance from Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are average, considering is place for stay the night while you enjoy Disneyland is a good option. Is a budget option if you think in a place for sleeping and get a shower, no more.

yes I knew it wasn't a 5 star hotel but the photos they use to advertise this place is very deceiving! Lots of wear and tear, mold under the ice box, ice box didn't get cold, a/c didn't work well, and it seemed as if majority of the rooms there were long term rentals.  Will never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: A good value close to Disneyland and California Adventure
Summary: The Rodeway Inn Maingate isn't a hotel for you if you need 3 stars and a lovely room with all the amenities.  The hotel rooms here were clean and neat with not the greatest surroundings.  But the hotel is inexpensive and very close to Disneyland enough to walk all the way there. the beds were comfortable and the water pressure in the bathroom was good.  If you are looking for fabulous digs then this isn't the hotel for you and you need to go somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Do not stay here! We checked-out as soon as we checked-in!
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE. You can find hotels near the parks for the same price that are worlds apart in cleanliness/comfort/EVERYTHING. We checked in and the front desk lady was very nice. She is the only good thing about that place. She really tried to help us out but the owner and the hotel itself are unreal. The rooms are nothing like the pictures! Don't be fooled like we were! Our room was awful - stains on the beds, the furniture was so old and odd, and bulky and mismatched. The walls, ALL THE WALLS, were dirty. Visibly dirty. The toilet seat was a shade of brown and chipping away extensively, the shower grout was stained black. All you have to do is bleach it with a toothbrush and it's clean! They let us look at 2 other rooms because there was no way we could stay in this one.

And this place has location! Just a brief walk through the Disneyland parking garage will take you to the constantly running Tram and entrance to the park. it used to be the Rodeway Main Gate, now it's the Anaheim Main Gate.It's not hard to figure why Rodeway dropped it.  It's a tired old 1950's motel. It was also MUCH cheaper than any other Disney area hotel, likke half. We were there 3 nights, and it wasn't as bad as some of the other reviewers claimed.  The beds were OK, and there was a fridge and microwave in the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful as we tried riding the city buses as we did not have a car. Yeah, you get what you pay for, but you're paying mucho dinero to hobnob with Mickey, so why spend time in a $300 hotel room? I thought it was sort of clean.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for

I wouldn't stay here again because of the hygiene issues, and we only slept in the room.

As far as hookers and junkies, I did see a few skanky characters moping around the property, but no one bothered us. Overall, I felt more ripped off by Disneyland, charging me full price for limited hours and numerous closed attractions than I did by the Rodeway.

I recently made my yearly pilgrimage to the NAMM Show in Anaheim, CA. I decided when I booked the room a few months in advance that I wasn't going to pay the outrageous rates that most of the hotels charged for the week ($120-$290 per night plus 15% tax). I came across the Rodeway Inn Maingate located right by Disneyland and only blocks from the Anaheim Convention Center.  First off, I couldn't believe how low the rate was. For a six night stay, I paid under $400, taxes included. This is approx. half of what I would have paid anywhere else in Anaheim. Secondly, I was surprised at how clean the rooms were and how comfortable the bed was. This was not a plush room by any means, but it was very, very clean. It also had a fridge and microwave. The door seemed very secure too.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Easy Access to Disneyland
Summary: I've stayed here a few times, most recently Christmas week. It's literally around the corner from the Disneyland parking lot, close to restaurants and gas stations and you have a perfect view of the Disneyland Fireworks show from the parking lot. The rooms are old and outdated, the hotel is family run and sometimes you have to wait for service in the lobby. HOWEVER, remember, the price is usually under $55 per night! You can't expect the Ritz Carlton for $55 per night. It's got everything that we need for a Disneyland trip...a clean bed, a clean bathroom, a microwave, a tv and a fridge. We've never had problems with crime, transients or felt unsafe. We've stayed a few times before and we'll stay again. Join the Choice Rewards points and earn free nights!

When I went in first I thought it wasn't too bad. The lock was BROKEN so we got locked in. The bathroom was dirty, it had dried gum and stains on the walls. There is a TERRIBLE stench. I went over to my parents room and I became nauseous. I thought it was nothing, but I ended up throwing up AFTER being there for 10 minutes and checking out. The person at the front desk was COMPLETELY rude. Me and a couple of other people were complaining and all he did was roll his eyes and avoid all our complaints. This place is terrible. Do not go here, unless you're planning to get sick and get disgusted. ALSO, there was broken ceilings and spiders. Gross.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel we've ever stayed in
Summary: This a cheap hotel, I don't mean just the price.  It does offer easy access to Disneyland, thru the Employee Parking lot.  The hotel is just not safe.  Hookers in the parking lot all night knocking on doors and discussing their rates, electrical issues, there is seldom anyone in the office so they leave notes on the front desk concerning your bill.  The towels are stained, the hot tub is boarded over, the internet connection is as unreliable as I have ever had - ever.  The many repairs in the room were poorly done, the hotel is in need of a complete transformation, or demolition.

Terrible Dirty unsafe place to stay! Changed a lot since I stayed there 5 years ago! No one at the front desk at night, cock roaches,  stinky filthy bathroom, You will be sorry if you choose to stay here, not fit for animals.

Found this motel, not to good, the room was very small, it had a wooden floor which Iv'e never come across before in a motel, the bathroom was very dark and there was parcel tape in a cross in the bath, to denote it was broken or cracked, it was very hot, but the AC was noisey there was only a tiny window to let in air, sorry but would not stay here again.

This hotel is very close to disneyland but i will never stay there again.  The rooms are very outdated

Summary Heading: Better to pay a little more and stay somewhere else
Summary: My biggest concern is for families... my room was not very clean or sanitary.  Stains on the sheets, walls and doors.  I have never seen so many black hairs in a bathroom at any place that I have ever stayed at than here.  Long black hairs were everywhere.  The hotel should consider making thier maids wear hairnets.  The cover of the air conditioning unit was missing which left wires and other parts exposed.  Not safe for children.  Pool was closed.  Parking was very limited and very tight.  The beds were old and flat. The price was low, but the value was not there...better to pay a little more and get the value you deserve.  I cannot recommend this hotel.

Have stayed there 3 seperate times and found it clean and comfortable. We go to spend our time at DISNEYLAND not at any hotel. Bed was comfortable, has micro and fridge,good sized room, cold airconditioning, good linen. The continental breakfast was slim but gave us enough to get to disneyland to get the breakfasts we really wanted. The walk to the tram is short and A.R.T. picks up right in front of hotel. We are in our 60's and stay anywhere from 7 to 9 days at a time. Nice management also.

Hotel staff are friendly and the free coffee in the morning if fairly decent, but overall the hotel is depressing.  The stairs are absolutely filthy.  Room is bare bones.  Room was pretty clean, but the hotel gave us the creeps.  Not worth the money we saved had we stayed somewhere else.

The parking is extremely limited and very tight, the room is very run down with torn carpet, curtains, and bedspreads, wallpaper coming off the walls, the furniture looks like it was sent through a wood chipper.  The AC was missing buttons, so you couldn't change the temperature. Summary Heading: If u just need a room to sleep......jackpot!!!!!!!
Summary: Has micro/fridge. Linens ok. Jaquizzi. Free parking.  No resort fees. The walk to the room from the DISNEYLAND tram is sooooooooo convenient!!!!!!! Am/pm 0.1 miles away About $50-60 to a night.  Con- if u walk from hotel to disney tram, it is about 15-20 minutes, cause u have to walk around the disney cast member lot.

This Hotel is my 3rd time comming here it has always been a pleasure to stay here with my family walking distance to Disneyland New ownership has took over and they are very pleasant always help me out what ever i needed I diffently would recomend this hotel to my friends and family.
better to go elsewhere, rooms disgustingly filthy, rooms smell like pot/cigarette smoke! we lasted half a night and had to check out. NEVER AGAIN

You have to pay for ice. Fridge/freezer not working. Air conditoner doesnt work and not only that, its actually falling apart. They gave us keys to a dirty room, wallpaper is peeling and mold all along the window sill, hole in the wall and you can see through a crack in the bathroom door. Holes in the window and no tv channel directory, breakfast time in motel book says 630 but wont let us in until 7. They "service" your room half assed. Toilet paper dispenser is broken. Took a half pack of my cigarettes, and the door is all scratched up. I hope they at least change the bedding between customers. Bird poop on the window. Bath tub takes about an hour to fill only half way. Shower drips water. This place is awful, do not waste your money

Summary Heading: What a Great place..5 minutes return trip from Disneyland, fireworks every night
Summary: I stayed her during the Fathers day weekend with my wife ,8 year old daughter and her friend. They loved the 9:30 firework show (From Disleyland) viewed from our parking lot. Everything worked fine and my daughter loved the pastries and Tang provided in the morning.  There is a bus that picks you up on the corner and takes you to Disneyland for $1.50. That coupled with a 5 min walk back, made it a steal of a deal.    No $15 a day parking,no long walk back,the fireworks on the night before Disneyland made this place a great stay.  Or you can PAY TWICE AS MUCH and stay across the street . (LOL)   Was it the Disneyland Hotel, no...but i can stay here for a week, for the same price as one night @ Disney.  Save your money for all the stuff the kids will want when youre at the park.

The weather outside was nice, a cool 71 degrees, however inside the room felt like 90 degrees. The room was so stuffy as if they had not opened a window or door in ages. I quickly turned on the old, beaten up ac; for the two days I stayed there the room never got cool enough. It was a very cheap ac system that you had to stand right next to to feel any cold air. I was miserable the whole time. And everything looks so old, form the towels, to the bathroom, and the old,ugly,dirty blankets. There are other hotels close to Disneyland with the same price that are so much better. Oh, and the parking was limited and horrible.

I was wary of this place based on the reviews, but when I got here, it was quite different that what I expected.  The owners are now involved and the old managers that were here are no longer involved.   For the price of $39, it was quite a bargain.  The other rooms in the area we've stayed are quite a bit smaller and on noisy streets for $10-$30 per night more.  I will definitely stay here again....

I stayed at this location during my recent trip to the park on 3/23-3/27 and I have to admit I was terrified. I read the reviews but was left with little options for someone traveling with 8 kids under 16 (only 3 are mine) plus 2 adults AND a super tight budget. There was also a cheer convention going on and employee days at the park. But I was ready with extra everything, bug spray, bed sheets and never used any of them!  So first this place is super cheap, I booked 4 nights, 2 rooms (223 & 229) both with two queen beds for under $600 so I was really expecting the worst. There is no elevator and 3 levels. Parking is super tight but I had no problems with finding a stall. The rooms were very spacious, as clean as an old motel can get and as quiet as one next to Disney can be.

I toured with rock bands for years - all levels - clubs and stadiums - so I've seen a lot of hotels. This one actually freaked me out. I wouldn't be surprised to see some 20/20 special with a reporter and a blue light.   It was too far to walk to Disneyland - no doubt. Well, to an entrance anyway. Couldn't let your kids do it. It was yucky - the carpet, the blankets - just not good.  If it weren't so late in the day by the time I got there to sleep - I would have drank a cup of coffee and attempted to make the drive home instead of staying.  Parking at Disney is what? $15? You can't walk from here so do yourself a favor and stay farther out in a place that isn't a dump. This place was not cheap and it was bad. The hotel is nearrer to the disneyland than we thought. We walked back just for several minutes. The employee was very friendly. The room is small and simple, but comfortable. The price is good. In a word, this is a good hotel to relax in disneyland.

This made walking to Disney almost impossible with younger children.  The whole hotel is need of updating.  The rooms are old and the beds were highly uncomfortable.  I don't think they have updated anything since the day it was first opened.  The bathroom was the same with stains in the tub and broken tiles.  I called the 1-800 number and canceled my other four days.

Summary Heading: if you can sleep with noise, here is a place for you
Summary: travel one night for business, the inn keeper is not too helpful.  Good: Free parking, near main street (Ball), clean room, black out drape, cable TV, microwave and small freezer. Not so good: the electric outlet is loose (and not GFCI), no chair in the room (but they give you a table), muffins+coffee+juice for breakfast. Bad: Traffic noise, imagine you sleep next to the freeway. I can stand it so no problem to me. In conclusion, you can't ask for much if you want a budget stay with decent location.

Summary Heading: I'm not a picky hotel person....but this is where I draw the line!!!
Summary: Checked in on a Thurs afternoon. Got the hotel free for three nights from Choice Hotels. The front desk lady was nice, but very hard to understand. We reserved a king bed and walked into our room with 2 queens. We called and she said the rooms with king beds were all full. So the next morning...at 7:30am the hotel phone rings waking us up. The lady was calling to tell us a king size bed was now available. AT 7:30AM!!! We just decided to deal with the room we had. The beds were comfy, tv worked, but a plug outlet was broken and my boyfriends phone was uncharged the entire next day. Summary Heading: There's a reason why it's so cheap!
Summary: The room was very plain looking.   The carpet had cuts and holes in it and areas that were sticky (if you enjoy wearing shoes in your hotel room, then this is your place).  The front desk people have a terrible attitude to them.  Like other ads say, the manager will give you a ride to Disney for $5. It is nice for getting there, but it is easy to walk back to the hotel. Take the Mickey and Friends tram and go to the second floor- walk through employee parking and you're back at the hotel.  The beds were terrible. Every morning my friend and I woke up in pain. It would have been more comfortable sleeping on the floor.  I gave the hotel a 2 for location because of the fireworks at night. You can easily see the Disneyland show which was an amazing show.

Summary Heading: Do not stay here if you like having hot water for your showers!
Summary: I stayed here for a week in July however I would not stay here again.  This hotel was about $15 less per night that surrounding hotels but there is definitely a reason for that!!!  First of all the front desk staff barely speaks english (and speaks no spanish at all) and they are very rude.  Second, and probably our biggest issue, three of the 7 mornings we woke up without hot water!  One morning we waited just over 3 hours for hot water and they did nothing about our room rate for that day.  Third, the internet is very sporadic so don't rely on being able to use it.  Lastly, the hotel calls itself Rodeway Inn Maingate...this is very misleading as it is a 15-20 minute walk to the main gate. Also the walls are paper thin...we heard another couple fighting and then making up.  We

Summary Heading: it was free - and we fled anyway
Summary: We used our Choice Hotel points to book this hotel near Disneyland - so it was free - and the place was so bad that we ditched the scene, lost our points, and to get a MUCH nicer room for just a tiny bit more money down the block.  Usually when I read terrible hotel reviews I think that the author is probably fussy, cranky, or otherwise prone to exaggeration.  In this case, all the bad reviews are justified: smelly old carpets, ancient furniture, strange appliances connected by tangled extension cords, everything old, in poor repair and of dubious cleanliness.  I have backpacked throughout Southeast Asia and Europe, and slept in many a fleabag hotel, but I've stayed in backpacker hostels in Bangkok that were far tidier and more inviting.  Don't do it!

I am 60 years old and I've never stayed a worse place than this.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for what I was expecting...
Summary: My daughter and I stayed there this past weekend for 3 nights.  I read all the reviews on this site after booking my stay and I was a little scared.  It wasn't bad at all actually.  Room was clean, no bed bugs, no curry smell and besides the fireworks from Disneyland, pretty darn quite.  Only 4 problems I had.  Hotel was not within walking distance.  Hot Tub was not at all hot and hotel staff barely speaks any English.  So trying to communicate was like trying to talk to my 4 yr old.  Also the Continental breakfast was not Continental, crappy tang, coffee and muffins.  You would be better off walking down to the mini-mart about a block down the street and stocking up on cereal and milk(the rooms have fridges)  Other than that, it was great.

Summary Heading: Hospitality Fireworks at this Clean place!!!
Summary: I was a bit hesitating while reserving a room at this place as the pictures were not that great. But got back worth and more of every penny I spent. The motel manager was one of the best hospitable I have ever met. Every bit understanding and adjusting; really caring for the guests. Place is very cleanly maintained. Rooms smell good, Linen fresh. I loved it. Location is good and Disney fireworks could be seen from balcony, but the real fireworks are those of hospitality. You will just love these people. Satish

Summary Heading: I would only recommend this hotel to the brave.
Summary: Very close to Disney, but not walkable.  Very rundown hotel.  Sink was new, sheets and surfaces were clean: mattress and floor were not.  Parking lot dark.  Breakfast was only coffee and 2 kinds of cheap muffins.  No hair dryer in room, and no one would come to the desk even after three bell rings in 10 min.  Quiet one night, noisy guests the next.  Only stay here if you can't afford somewhere else.  I am a cheapo, but this place made me a little nervous health wise.

We booked this place for our recent holiday trip in Southern California. Thank God we only stayed here for one night and got there late after spending the entire day at Disneyland since this place is a hideous cheap motel with not even a decent parking lot for its guests. The rooms and bathrooms are absolutely disgusting, half of the appliances don't work, the reception office stinks like curry and if that wasn't enough some of the rooms are long term rented so expect to be awaken by an idiot fixing its truck in the parking lot while yelling at his pregnant girlfriend. There are PLENTY of other options in this area so do yourself and your family a favor and go somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Worse place i have stayed in!!!
Summary: I have stayed at the Motel 8 Anaheim, which I thought was supposed to be the lowest of the low – but it was quite alright, humble but alright.  I am still on a budget but wanted to move up a bit; therefore, I booked the Roadway Inn Maingate which advertised itself as across the street from Disney.  Well, it’s NOT across the street; it’s next to the parking lot/employee entrance.  Coming back it’s about a 2 minute walk but to get there you have to walk for 1/2 hr, pay a taxi cab ($10), or take the shuttle ($3/adult, $1/child), or give $6 to the inn staff to drive you.  The office is tiny & is connected to the owner’s home.  It stinks like curry.  There is no elevator, there was garbage & empty beer bottles on the hallways.  I asked for a smoke-free room, the door had a smoke-free

We stayed at the Roadway Inn-Maingate 2 days in October, for family trip to Disneyland. The front desk is very friendly, helpfull and excellent. This is very close to Disneyland and we love it. We really recommend this motel to our friends and families. we'd like to come back again.

I read all the reviews AFTER my mom had booked the hotel. I was a little skeptical about the hotel, but after only one night's stay I was absolutely wow'd! The manager is awesome and very helpful. The rooms are pretty roomy for the price you pay, and extremely clean! (no bed bugs, mind you!) Not only that, but the location is outstanding! Just a 10-15 minute walk from Disneyland! And if you decide to leave the park early, you can watch the fireworks show right from the hotel! I'd recommend this hotel any day for an affordable and pleasurable experience.

The rooms are filthy You could push in the top of the room doors in about 10 inches nothing to stop anyone from entering your room. after canceling the room do to the problems there they said there would be no charge but when I returned home they did charge for the room not only charge for the room but at a higher rate than the reservation was made for . When i called them they would not take the charges off or help in anyway. They even Lied about who was at their front desk and said the Male Arab that I talked to wasn't on duty.

Summary Heading: Not convenient to Disneylad--no amenities--no "continental breakfast"
Summary: If you want to stay somewhere nice on your vacation to Disneyland this is not the place!  The Cons outway the Pros.  No ammenites at all except the room has a good-size refrigerator and has a microwave.  Rooms are small with alot of wear and tear (not worth $60 a night---luckily we didn't pay that much), but they are clean.  The room had no remote control for the television.  They would put out only one--.04 oz. packet of shampoo.  Their idea of a "continental breakfast" is some muffins and coffee and tang-like orange juice.  The parking is absolutely atrocious--not enough space to barely pull into the motel itself let alone parking.  It doesn't help when the owners park their own Mercedes vehicle also in the customer parking lot.  This motel called "Maingate" is totally

But they did not adjust ther paper work, so I was charged the full stay when I revied my credit card statement. I contacted the hotel and the Hotel management was very rude and not even listening. So my Disney experience  was totally ruined... NEVER AGAIN!!!

Well, when we drove up, we were a bit worried.  The parking lot is very small and the lobby door was in need of repair.  The lady behind the desk was pleasant enough, very thick accent.  The biggest problem I found was that they advertised as Maingate and they are far from it.  They are more than a block away, we walked for about a mile or more.  Transportation to and from is not clear.  We got a room on the 3rd floor, the stairs going up there were hard to find and looked very scary with no lighting.  The room was bigger then we expected the bathroom was almost as big as the room, it had a jacuzzi tub and seperate shower.  It appeared clean.  The A/C worked well, the blinds were broken and laying around on the floor.  There is free internet and a fridge and microwave in the

We climbed into bed for the first night and my husband just said he was bit by something, I turned on the light and our bed was covered in bed bugs.  The mgmt said they would put us in another room but we declined and quickly checked out.  They also said this has never happened at their hotel before but as I read the rest of the reviews, I don't believe it.  They need to fumigate before letting anyone else stay there.

We entered the tiny lobby to find that we were alone.  After a few rings of the bell a fairly pleasant woman appeared behind the desk.  The language barrier made check in challenging, but not impossible.  The process, however,  was laborious and overly long.  Just take my money and give me a key.  I want to get  to Disneyland while it’s still popular.  It felt like we stood there for weeks.  Towards the end of week three, the lady asked for a credit card, which I happily provided.  She must have been hungry because while she was completing my paperwork…I couldn’t make this up…she held my credit card in her mouth. Summary Heading: I BEG you to please please avoid this hotel!!!

So for our trip to Disneyland, I saw that this was one of the cheapest ones and since it was really close to Disneyland, that it would be good enough. We got to our room and everything seemed neat and tidy. The room was equipped with everything you needed: tv, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, etc.   So nighttime came and we went to sleep. All of a sudden, the smoke alarm started going off. So my mom turned the lights on and it stopped. Everything seemed fine, no smoke, no fire, nothing. So we were puzzled as to why the alarm went off. We went back to bed, and not a minute after we turned the
Manager Response: In responce to the Bed bug room in question. THese rooms have been total renovated with ALL new furniture and carpets have been place in this rooms.  We just had an inspection and no bed bugs were found, inspite we had the room sprayed again.

Summary: We went out to Anaheim for a quick trip to DisneyLand. I had booked our hotel through Travelocity and although we usually stay at the Ramada Maingate, I was trying to save money and instead booked a different Maingate hotel for $60- the Rodeway Inn Maingate. The internet couldn't locate the address according to Travelocity nor could our GPS system. No problem, I thought-  as soon as we got out of the parks, we would call the hotel and get the directions, pronto!  We left the parks at 7:30 PM on Wednesday night... And then spent 2 hours calling the number provided by Travelocity attempting to reach a human being! Instead, we were repeatedly put to a phone loop and no one answered the phone!  Called Travelocity to see if they knew the cross streets of this hotel- of course, they

Summary Heading: 'Having Room 333 is half the problem,' says the Beast
Summary: I read the reviews before making my reservation for this hotel.  I like staying at Choice Hotel properties because of its value and service.   Although I did not smell any curry when I went to the lobby (the managers' apartment is connected with the front desk and lobby), the breakfast service was hardly anything to look at.  You need to get there really early, because if you don't get there one-half hour before the service ends, you will be out of luck.  And it's just stale donuts and reheated muffins.  No hot water for tea and you get old coffee.  Service was OK.  The manager is not very coherent, but if he repeats himself, he can be understood.  His wife is not much better. Summary Heading: The basics and a great fireworks show
Summary: We stayed at the Rodeway for a Friday and Saturday night (about $72 a night including taxes). The hotel is just around the corner from Disneyland and as close or closer than most of the area hotels. It is walking distance.  The hotel itself is a bit of a mixed bag - it shows its age, but for the most part is pretty clean and comfortable. Apparently there is a theft problem because you need to get a remote from the front desk and if you want a hair dryer, leave a $5 deposit.  While this is a Choice Hotel, it is a big step below the Comfort Inns and much more like a Motel 6 or Super 8. However, the rooms did have a microwave and refrigerator (which was a huge plus because the only ice machine was broken).  As a very nice surprise, the hotel provides free high-speed wireless

Seven months later and I'm still in therapy after our stay! Okay, I exaggerate, but it was a nightmare of an experience. The shower faucet handle obviously didn't work, makes me wonder how they cleaned it. Microwave was broken, coffee maker was broken, but the worst was the smell. If you like curry you'll love it there 'cause the place is permeated with the odor. I was nauseated 2 days later. We had to scramble to find another place...at Christmas! I don't care if they gave me the place for free, I wouldn't stay again.

The hotel is off West Place near Ball and Disneyland Drive. The Staff was very friendly. Our room was very nice, a little worn around the edges but in overall great shape. Rooms come wth fridge, microwave, and coffee maker at no extra charge. The TV gets more cable channels then you would ever need and HBO as well.  The room was probably in better shape than most budget hotels in the area. We paid only  $48 with tax thru the Choice Hotels website for a tuesday night. For the $ This Hotel is one of best deals around the park. I couldn't find a rate lower than $60 at any hotels nearby. We walked up to the third floor and found out we were upgraded to a Jacuzzi Suite! Spacious room with a king bed and huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. There is a small outdoor jacuzzi for everyones

Disappointed that we were unable to walk through employee parking to get to Disneyland (apparently you could before) as this hotel is right behind the Park but the Inn offerred low cost shuttle. Rooms had fridge, microwave, were roomy although a bit dated but any issue we had was dealt with immediately by helpful and friendly staff. Bring a hairdryer. Window view of fireworks! Good value; we used the savings at Disneyland. I would stay there again just to visit with sweet owners! Thanks!

I stayed at the Rodeway Maingate with family and friends.  I shared a room with my partner and his family (parents and two young siblings) shared another.   We paid $55/night per room and thought we received more than our moneys worth.  Both rooms were very large with TVs, microwaves and refrigerators.  The towels were worn, but everything was VERY clean; sheets, shower, floors, etc.  Location was close to Disneyland; this is why we stayed here.  We walked less than 10 minutes to the parking garage and then took the tram to the park.  The hotel was very convenient to come back to for a midday rest.  For the price, we were extremely satisfied!

I've booked the room over the Internet and recomfirm again a week before I arrived but when I show up the room was full.  I've tried to compain  to choice but it seem like they didn't care. Nobody get back to me at all.  Kitiwat

Summary: We stayed at the Rodeway Inn for one night on August 3, 2006.  If you are an extreme budget traveller and want to stay near Disneyland, then this is the place for you. When I checked in, the front desk informed me that there would be a five dollar deposit for the remote control.  Since I didn't have it in cash I asked her to put it on the credit card, she said she couldn't and that if she did she would forget to refund it to me.  Okay.      Our room was 106. I was also a tad worried after reading what other people wrote but the price/location combo made me decide to chance it. Folks, really, lets be reasonable in how we judge hotel rooms!  I paid $40/night inclusive -- Keeping in mind that it was off season I called them directly and negotiated a better rate than Hotels was offering -- for a perfectly clean room, albeit a tad worn (stains in the ceiling, could use a new coat a paint, some of the furniture is clearly used), with two reasonably comfortable queen size beds, a small fridge, a  very clean bathroom and a microwave oven. We had covered parking for our car, and the best part was it was at most a 6 minute walk from the hotel room to the tram that takes you from the parking lot to the parks!  For $40/night what to you want?!

I agree with the reviews from Nov. 15th and Nov. 28th, 2005: The cleanliness of this hotel is not perfect, but acceptable, and the location is super! Except, that is, for the few hotels close to the Mickey & Friends parking structure: here, you walk through the cast member parking lot (maybe 50 yards), up two flights of stairs, 100 yards down a long corridor, down an escalator---and you're boarding the parking lot tram, which runs every 2 minutes or so. I was there over Thanksgiving, and paid only 44.10 per night, so I wasn't expecting too much. I was pleasantly surprised at the location (right next to the parking lot where the tram takes you to the park!) and that saves $10 bucks a day in parking, or walking to a shuttle.  The room was small, but about the size of a Motel 6. It did have a fridge and microwave, a decent T.V, the beds where comfortable, and the rooms were clean. The room was ok (nothing fancy) but everythig was working pretty good, being honest I arrived to the hotel after reading several reviews that scared me however I was lucky and everything was fine.

Summary: My brother, mother and I flew to Anaheim for a quick weekend getaway.  I chose this inn mainly b/c it was so close to Disneyland, which is where we wanted to go, and b/c it was just so cheap!  The inn itself should receive one star.  It is quite terrible and I can understand how others would be horrified.  We had called a few days beforehand to make sure that they allowed late check-in, since we caught a red-eye flight and when we got to the inn, the office was closed.  We had to bang on the doors and ring the doorbells for about ten minutes until a TEENAGER came out and gave us keys and checked us in.    I had read previous reviews of the rodeway and was prepared for the worst.  I only saw one tiny bug crawling on the telephone which was not such a problem.  It was a crappy

The rooms where bad, I stayed April 9th with some friends and we had three rooms. There was at least one thing that didn't work in each room. The bathrooms weren't very clean, beds are the worst ive ever slept on. I got charged more for one room because it was "different" which I couldn't tell what the difference was but couldn't do anything about it. Even when I reserved the room in Feb. and they told me they where all the same rate at the time. I wouldn't stay again at this hotel, save your money and just get a better hotel.

The room I reserved was not available upon arrival, yet they would not cancel my reservation. There were bugs in the bathroom & a huge spider by the bed. The TV remote control was broken. The hottub didn't work. Kids were playing soccer by my vehicle. Never again. I complained to management and to national office and they offered nothing but "sorry." Third world operation, indeed.

Filthy carpets in hallways, rooms somewhat better.  We had to take the curtains off the windows and pin them lower, as there was a good 6-inch gap between the curtains and the windowsill on the bottom (and the window in the bathroom ends at about knee-height, so when you're "seated", you're onstage if you don't move the curtains).  Saggy bed, smelly room, really smelly hallway.  One bright spot - huge bathroom!  Still, was smelly.  Not worth saving just a couple of bucks.
